remarks: Lemma for ~ jm2.26 .  Use ~ acongrep to find K', M' ~~ K, M in [ 0,N ]. Thus Y(K') ~~ Y(M') and both are small; K' = M' on pain of contradicting 2.24, so K ~~ M (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Oct-2014.)
statement: jm2.26lem3 $p |- ( ( ( A e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) /\ N e. NN ) /\ ( K e. ( 0 ... N ) /\ M e. ( 0 ... N ) ) /\ ( ( A rmX N ) || ( ( A rmY K ) - ( A rmY M ) ) \/ ( A rmX N ) || ( ( A rmY K ) - -u ( A rmY M ) ) ) ) -> K = M ) $.
